Organism_Record.Function_Summary: Inhibits the synthesis of a number of cytokines, including IFN-gamma, IL-2, IL-3, TNF and GM-CSF produced by activated macrophages and by helper T-cells.

Funtion.Detail: The function that stimulates a cell to grow or proliferate. Most growth factors have other actions besides the induction of cell growth or proliferation.
Functions to control the survival, growth, differentiation and effector function of tissues and cells.
Interacting selectively and non-covalently with the interleukin-10 receptor.

BioProcess.Detail: The movement of a leukocyte in response to an external stimulus.
Any process that activates or increases the frequency, rate or extent of activity of a transcription factor, any factor involved in the initiation or regulation of transcription.
BioProcess.Keyword: Positive regulation of transcription factor activity

BioProcess.Detail: Any process that activates or increases the frequency, rate or extent of cellular DNA-dependent transcription.
The expansion of a B cell population by cell division. Follows B cell activation.

The immediate defensive reaction (by vertebrate tissue) to infection or injury caused by chemical or physical agents. The process is characterized by local vasodilation, extravasation of plasma into intercellular spaces and accumulation of white blood cells and macrophages.

A change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a glucocorticoid stimulus. Glucocorticoids are hormonal C21 corticosteroids synthesized from cholesterol with the ability to bind with the cortisol receptor and trigger similar effects. Glucocorticoids act primarily on carbohydrate and protein metabolism, and have anti-inflammatory effects.

An immune response which is associated with resistance to extracellular organisms such as helminths and pathological conditions such as allergy, which is orchestrated by the production of particular cytokines, most notably IL-4, IL-5, IL-10, and IL-13, by any of a variety of cell types including T-helper 2 cells, eosinophils, basophils, mast cells, and nuocytes, resulting in enhanced production of certain antibody isotypes and other effects.
Any process that stops, prevents, or reduces the frequency, rate or extent of the chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of interferon-alpha.
BioProcess.Keyword: Negative regulation of interferon-alpha biosynthetic process

BioProcess.Detail: A change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a lipopolysaccharide stimulus; lipopolysaccharide is a major component of the cell wall of gram-negative bacteria.
Any process that stops, prevents, or reduces the frequency, rate, or extent of interleukin-6 production.
Any process that stops, prevents, or reduces the frequency, rate, or extent of cytokine secretion contributing to an immune response.
BioProcess.Keyword: Negative regulation of cytokine secretion involved in immune response

BioProcess.Detail: The chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of a receptor molecule, a macromolecule that undergoes combination with a hormone, neurotransmitter, drug or intracellular messenger to initiate a change in cell function.
A process which directly inhibits any of the steps required for cell death by apoptosis.
The selective interaction of the transcription factor NF-kappaB with specific molecules in the cytoplasm, thereby inhibiting its translocation into the nucleus.
Any process that stops, prevents, or reduces the frequency, rate or extent of membrane protein ectodomain proteolysis.
BioProcess.Keyword: Negative regulation of membrane protein ectodomain proteolysis

BioProcess.Detail: Any process that mediates the transfer of information from one cell to another.
Any process that activates or increases the frequency, rate, or extent of B cell apoptosis.
BioProcess.Keyword: Positive regulation of B cell apoptosis

BioProcess.Detail: Any process that stops, prevents or reduces the rate or extent of B cell proliferation.
BioProcess.Keyword: Negative regulation of B cell proliferation

BioProcess.Detail: Any process that stops, prevents, or reduces the frequency, rate or extent of the chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of MHC class II.
BioProcess.Keyword: Negative regulation of MHC class II biosynthetic process

BioProcess.Detail: The process in which a precursor cell type acquires the specialized features of a B cell. A B cell is a lymphocyte of B lineage with the phenotype CD19-positive and capable of B cell mediated immunity.
Any process that activates or increases the frequency, rate or extent of the regulated release of cytokines from a cell or group of cells.
Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of isotype switching.
Any process that stops, prevents or reduces the rate or extent of T cell proliferation.
BioProcess.Keyword: Negative regulation of T cell proliferation

Disease.Disease_Name: Inflammatory Bowel Disease 25, Early Onset, Autosomal Recessive
Rapid Progression to Aids from Hiv1 Infection

PDB.PDB_Title: INTERLEUKIN-10 CRYSTAL STRUCTURE REVEALS THE FUNCTIONAL DIMER WITH AN UNEXPECTED TOPOLOGICAL SIMILARITY TO INTERFERON GAMMA
PDB.PubMed_Title: Crystal structure of interleukin-10 reveals the functional dimer with an unexpected topological similarity to interferon gamma.
PDB.Author: Zdanov, A., et al.

PDB.PDB_Title: Crystal structure of human IL-10 complexed with the soluble IL-10R1 chain
PDB.PubMed_Title: Same structure, different function crystal structure of the Epstein-Barr virus IL-10 bound to the soluble IL-10R1 chain.
PDB.Author: Yoon, S.I., et al.

PDB.PDB_Title: CRYSTAL STRUCTURE OF HUMAN INTERLEUKIN-10 AT 1.6 ANGSTROMS RESOLUTION
PDB.PubMed_Title: Crystal structure of human interleukin-10 at 1.6 A resolution and a model of a complex with its soluble receptor.
PDB.Author: Zdanov, A., et al.

PDB.PubMed_Title: Crystal structure of the IL-10/IL-10R1 complex reveals a shared receptor binding site.
PDB.Author: Josephson, K., et al.

PDB.PubMed_Title: Conformational changes mediate interleukin-10 receptor 2 (IL-10R2) binding to IL-10 and assembly of the signaling complex.
PDB.Author: Yoon, S.I., et al.

PDB.PDB_Title: ENGINEERED HUMAN INTERLEUKIN-10 MONOMER COMPLEXED TO 9D7 FAB FRAGMENT
PDB.PubMed_Title: Noncompetitive antibody neutralization of IL-10 revealed by protein engineering and x-ray crystallography.
PDB.Author: Josephson, K., et al.

PDB.PubMed_Title: Crystal structure of interleukin 10 reveals an interferon gamma-like fold.
PDB.Author: Walter, M.R., et al.
